inkball

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.Block

  • public class Block
extends java.lang.Object
    represent a block, it includes wall, spawner, etc. For more detail, please see the below instruction

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean animation
      indicate whether edge tile is used for ending enimation, true means are currently used for settlement animation, false otherwise
      java.lang.String blockType
      The block could be: (1) W: wall from 0 - 4; (2) S: spawner; (3) H: hole; (4) B: initial ball spawner; (5) T: tile;
      float[] bottomLeft
      bottomLeft corner point of current block, used for collision detection
      float[] bottomRight
      bottomRight corner point of current block, used for collision detection
      boolean bouncy
      indicate whether block is Bouncy, namely, only "W" block is bouncy
      int bouncyNum
      indicate how many times bouncy block is hit by the corresponding ball, notice that Different colour bricks can only be damaged by the ball of corresponding colour, unless itâ€™s a grey brick.
      java.lang.String color
      except for "T", "S" and "B", all blocks have color, namely, "T", "S" and "B" will have "colorless" color and "-1" colorIndex
      java.lang.String colorIndex
      the color index of corresponding color, for detail, refer to App.colorIndex
      boolean ImageBlock
      H: hole only needs top left block to draw the image, so this variable will only be used for "H" block
      int imageBlockSize
      image size of current block, "H" block should be twice larger than other block.
      float[] upperLeft
      upperLeft corner point of current block, used for collision detection
      float[] upperRight
      upperRight corner point of current block, used for collision detection
      int x
      x coordinate of block
      int y
      y coordinate of block

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Block(int x, int y, java.lang.String blockType, java.lang.String color, boolean ImageBlock)
      Block constructor

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • x

        public int x
        x coordinate of block

      • y

        public int y
        y coordinate of block

      • animation

        public boolean animation
        indicate whether edge tile is used for ending enimation, true means are currently used for settlement animation, false otherwise

      • blockType

        public java.lang.String blockType
        The block could be: (1) W: wall from 0 - 4; (2) S: spawner; (3) H: hole; (4) B: initial ball spawner; (5) T: tile;

      • ImageBlock

        public boolean ImageBlock
        H: hole only needs top left block to draw the image, so this variable will only be used for "H" block

      • imageBlockSize

        public int imageBlockSize
        image size of current block, "H" block should be twice larger than other block.

      • color

        public java.lang.String color
        except for "T", "S" and "B", all blocks have color, namely, "T", "S" and "B" will have "colorless" color and "-1" colorIndex

      • colorIndex

        public java.lang.String colorIndex
        the color index of corresponding color, for detail, refer to App.colorIndex

      • bouncy

        public boolean bouncy
        indicate whether block is Bouncy, namely, only "W" block is bouncy

      • bouncyNum

        public int bouncyNum
        indicate how many times bouncy block is hit by the corresponding ball, notice that Different colour bricks can only be damaged by the ball of corresponding colour, unless itâ€™s a grey brick.

      • upperLeft

        public float[] upperLeft
        upperLeft corner point of current block, used for collision detection

      • upperRight

        public float[] upperRight
        upperRight corner point of current block, used for collision detection

      • bottomLeft

        public float[] bottomLeft
        bottomLeft corner point of current block, used for collision detection

      • bottomRight

        public float[] bottomRight
        bottomRight corner point of current block, used for collision detection

    • Constructor Detail

      • Block

        public Block(int x,
             int y,
             java.lang.String blockType,
             java.lang.String color,
             boolean ImageBlock)
        Block constructor
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of block
        y - The y coordinate of block
        blockType - The block type of block, refer to class variable explain
        color - The color of block
        ImageBlock - Indicate whether we need to draw image for current block, since some block is part of the large block, such as a hole need 4 blocks but only top left block need to draw image
